qas.question: Why were mosaics destroyed in the iconoclastic era?
What was the common mosaic theme of iconoclastic churches?

answers.text: gold mosaics with only one great cross

qas.question: When did the Iconodules  change the cross in the Hagia Sophia?
When was the Dormition church destroyed?
When did the Hagia Irene adapt the iconoclastic era mosaics?

context: In the Iconoclastic era, figural mosaics were also <a0_0>condemned as idolatry<a0_0/>. The Iconoclastic churches were embellished with plain <a1_0>gold mosaics with only one great cross<a1_0/> in the apse like the Hagia Irene in Constantinople (<a4_0>after 740<a4_0/>). There were similar crosses in the apses of the Hagia Sophia Church in Thessaloniki and in the Church of the Dormition in Nicaea. The crosses were substituted with the image of the Theotokos in both churches after the victory of the Iconodules (<a2_0>787–797<a2_0/> and in 8th–9th centuries respectively, the Dormition church was totally destroyed in <a3_0>1922<a3_0/>).
